H1.text: Astronomy benefited most from these discoveries, such as Leeuwenhoek's improved microscopes and lenses in the 1600s that revealed bacteria and muscle fibers.

H2.text: Medicine benefited most from Anton van Leeuwenhoek's 1600s discoveries of bacteria and muscle fibers made possible by his improved microscopes and lenses.

H3.text: Teaching benefited most from Anton van Leeuwenhoek’s 1600s discoveries of bacteria and muscle fibers, which he made possible with his improved microscopes and self‑made lenses.

A4.text: He was also the first to document microscopic observations of muscle fibers, bacteria, spermatozoa, red blood cells, and crystals in gouty tophi.

A5.text: He was the first to observe cells, much like Robert Hooke.
